explain:
To express a main concept or theme
Core idea: Wales and Belgium will face each other in a Euro 2016 qualifier match at the Cardiff City Stadium on June 12, 2016, with a capacity of 33,000 people. The match is crucial for both teams, as the winner will secure one of the top spots and improve their position in the Euro 2016 qualifying table. Chris Coleman's Wales team aims to claim the top spot and have a significant advantage over the other teams in the group. This match has a major impact on both teams, as it could help either team to qualify or be eliminated from the competition. The match also has a personal significance for Gareth Bale, who is expected to play a key role in the game, following his success in the Euro 2012 qualifier match against England at the Cardiff City Stadium. However, securing enough tickets might be difficult for some fans, as general admission tickets are sold out due to UEFA rules, while only a limited number of seats are available for purchase.
